EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Occidental Chemical Corporation Deer Park VCM Site III facility at Deer Park, Texas, is a producer of industrial chemicals.  Occidental Chemical Corporation (OxyChem) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Occidental Petroleum Corporation.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Stationary Source (A§ 68.155(a))

Occidental Chemical Corporation has established a system for the safe operation of the processes at this facility that includes the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  One component of this system is a program to manage the risks of accidental releases at the Deer Park VCM Site III facility.  This program conforms to the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirement Risk Management Programs (the RMP rule) and requirements of OSHA 1910.119.  This document is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirement of the RMP rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at the Deer Park VCM Site III facility.

The Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled (A§ 68.155(b))

The Deer Park VCM Site III facility consists of a single chemical production plant that is owned and operated by OxyChem.  A single process has been defined for this stationary source: Vinyl Chloride Storage.  The facility handles one substance that is regulated by the RMP rule - 

Vinyl Chloride

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Specific Prevention Steps (A§ 68.155(c))

The Deer Park VCM Site III facility's prevention program has been prepared so that it conforms to both the OSHA Process Safety Management and the EPA Risk Management Plan regulations.  The program consists of the following elements:

Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity, Management of Change, Pre-Startup Review, Compliance Audits, I

ncident Investigation, Employee Participation, Key Procedures, Contractors.

Each of the items listed above are documented and maintained in manuals at the facility.  These manuals are routinely updated.

Five-year Accident History (A§ 68.155(d))

There were no RMP accidents within the Vinyl Chloride Storage process during the past 5 years.

Emergency Response Program (A§ 68.155(e))

The Deer Park VCM Site III facility has established a written emergency response plan and maintains an emergency response team (ERT) trained in these emergency response procedures.  All plant personnel are trained in evacuation procedures and in-plant drills are conducted periodically.  The drills are used to test the response time of the Emergency Response Team, to test the plant employee accountability program, and to activate the plant's Emergency Operations Center (EOC).  In addition, the Deer Park VCM Site III facility has developed a Special Situations Plan (SSP) which is a program designed for responding to emergencies that may have impacts beyond the immediate plant and is a supplement to the Emergency Response Plan.  The Special Situation Plan links the local response to the OxyChem Corporate Emergency Response Center located in Dallas, Texas.

The facility is a member of the Deer Park Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), which includes industrial and public entities.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety (A§ 68.155(f))

The Deer Park VCM Site III facility constantly tries to improve the safety of the processes through annual reviews of our plant procedures, near misses and incident investigation programs, and a program soliciting safety and environmental suggestions from the plant employees.
